bug.author: coatless
bug.summary: Solaris issues for mlpack R bindings

comments.comment: Thanks James, we know. I also sent that along via DM. The floor is being fixed, the auto_ptr is AFAIK a Boost issue which needs a compiler flag we may actually not be allow to set in src/Makevars (for not "being portable") and OpenMP works else where so ...

I am banging away at the Solaris builder at <denchmark-link:https://builder.r-hub.io>RHub</denchmark-link> -- after the issue I have hit two similar ones with first GMM and then HMM where is applied on an int. Silly compiler should really cast that up as C++11 generally does and we do set C++11 as the compilation standard....

Perhaps the lack of the std:: prefix is causing the problem?
Yes, it may fall back to the C level functions. I am currently just trying to see how many of these there are and am doing the 'poor man casting' of multiplying with 1.0.

Reports from clang and gcc on UBSAN are in with a lot of Boost noise, plus a lto check report with more and other stuff from Boost. See <denchmark-link:https://cloud.r-project.org/web/checks/check_results_mlpack.html>https://cloud.r-project.org/web/checks/check_results_mlpack.html</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> Would be useful for the fixes proposed here to be part of PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/2755>#2755</denchmark-link>

A likely bigger issue now are the UBSAN gcc and clang reports, and the LTO report. See <denchmark-link:https://cloud.r-project.org/web/checks/check_results_mlpack.html>https://cloud.r-project.org/web/checks/check_results_mlpack.html</denchmark-link>

For I have tried to reproduce the error using <denchmark-link:https://builder.r-hub.io/status/mlpack_3.4.3.tar.gz-68bee74880da416cac93bc4aa6759a09>rhub::check_with_sanitizers()</denchmark-link> for master branch(now we are using for serialization) with the minimal R-bindings (only ), but it working fine with the master branch, Hence a new release might resolve the issue regarding ubsan. Due to lack of time I didn't dig it more, hence my assumptions might be wrong here ðŸ˜… .

Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/eddelbuettel>@eddelbuettel</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Yashwants19>@Yashwants19</denchmark-link> for the patches! I've applied them to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/2755>#2755</denchmark-link> but with a couple really minor changes:
That floor(int) was strange. I reworked the code (int is already floored...) to simplify. I applied the other std:: changes. I chose to rename visitors in methods/rann/ instead, simply because methods/neighbor_search/ is the "standard" neighbor search technique and rann is the "weird" one. Also, I renamed a few more visitors that have the same name in each directory but LTO didn't throw an issue about.
I assume we don't have to worry about the r-oldrel checks, which fail like this: ERROR: this R is version 3.6.2, package 'mlpack' requires R >= 4.0.0 The only thing that should remain are the UBSAN issues. Those are related to boost serialization internals, and should probably no longer be an issue when we have a release with cereal. But... I don't really want to rush an mlpack 4.0.0 release just so that we can pass these checks. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/eddelbuettel>@eddelbuettel</denchmark-link> Is there a way we can ask for an exception here? "Boost is not our code...", etc. Also, should I resubmit a patched .tar.gz with the patches above to CRAN, or is there anything else we should handle first?

Nice, and thanks for <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Yashwants19>@Yashwants19</denchmark-link> to work through the lto issue! Yes, r-oldrel is ok. We can ignore. As for Boost, we can clearly mention this as 'not us'. This has come up before, and will again. They know. Better yet, we even have a change in the pipeline. There is no resubmission. You need a new release number but ("this time") I would suggested to just add a fourth digit to not force a release of all other things mlpack. So 3.4.2.1 would be my suggestion.
Thanks. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> and I were briefly noodling over this too via Slack DMs.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Yashwants19>@Yashwants19</denchmark-link> shouldn't this be instead of ?
... +#if BOOST_VERSION == 107500 + if(BOOST_SERIALIZATION_NULL_POINTER_TAG == cid){ +#else if(NULL_POINTER_TAG == cid){ +#endif ...

Good catch. Also, we (as in me maintaining for ) jumped from 1.72 to 1.75 so I cannot tell you if that change is from 1.75 or 1.74. or 1.74. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> has a simpler fix of just defining off if the former is undefined.
Just FYI the overall progress for BH 1.75.0 and packages is monitored in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/eddelbuettel/bh/issues/76>this issue at its repo</denchmark-link> .

I took a look, and Boost 1.73.0 is where the name changes from to . I adapted <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Yashwants19>@Yashwants19</denchmark-link> 's patch, applied it, and resubmitted to CRAN as 3.4.2.1. Let's see what happens... :)

I think this can be closed out as 3.4.2.1 hit CRAN on 12/18 and resolved the major problems ðŸŽ‰. The only issues that remain are a few UBs around boost that are "upstreams" problem.
